summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing dated November 20, 2020, summarizing national and international news. It covers a wide range of topics including criminal investigations, counter-terrorism, cybersecurity, political developments, and COVID-19. The briefing includes numerous unrelated criminal cases but no specific information directly related to Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item speculating he could be next to lose his job in the Trump administration.

persons.name: Gina Haspel
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item speculating she could be next to lose her job in the Trump administration.

persons.name: David DeVillers
persons.context: Discussed the corruption case against Cincinnati Councilman P.G. Sittenfeld, referencing a 'culture of corruption'.

persons.name: P.G. Sittenfeld
persons.context: Arrested and indicted on federal bribery and corruption charges related to a real estate development project.

persons.name: Chris Hoffman
persons.context: Commented on the public corruption task force remaining in place following councilman arrests.

persons.name: Jeff Pastor
persons.context: Previously arrested on corruption charges for allegedly accepting bribes from undercover FBI agents.

persons.name: Tamaya Dennard
persons.context: Previously arrested and charged with wire fraud, bribery, and attempted extortion; pleaded guilty.

persons.name: John Cranley
persons.context: Commented on the harms of corruption scandals following the arrest of a third council member.

persons.name: Chris Krebs
persons.context: Recently fired; mentioned in cybersecurity news regarding political pressure on election security.

persons.name: Suzanne Spaulding
persons.context: Commented on the challenge of overcoming the chilling effect after Krebs' firing.

persons.name: Brandon Wales
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential replacement for Chris Krebs.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Held a news conference making claims about election fraud; his statements were analyzed by media.

persons.name: Sidney Powell
persons.context: Part of Trump's legal team; made claims about voting machines at Giuliani's news conference.

persons.name: Jenna Ellis
persons.context: Part of Trump's legal team; present at Giuliani's news conference.

persons.name: Michael Driscoll
persons.role: FBI Special Agent in Charge (Philadelphia Division)
persons.context: Commented on the bribery charges against former Philadelphia revenue employees.

persons.name: Robert Hughes
persons.context: Commented on the takedown of a Wisconsin drug trafficking ring.

persons.name: Kristi Johnson
persons.role: FBI Assistant Director in Charge (Los Angeles Field Office)
persons.context: Commented on reported jet pack sightings near LAX.

persons.name: William Sweeney Jr.
persons.context: Commented on the arrest of a New York doctor on narcotics charges.

persons.name: Pao Mei Fisher
persons.context: Provided a sworn statement in a child exploitation case in New York.

events.title: Cincinnati Councilman Indicted
events.description: Cincinnati City Councilman P.G. Sittenfeld was indicted on six federal counts related to bribery and extortion, accused of soliciting $40,000 for his PAC in exchange for votes on a development project.

events.title: Giuliani Election Fraud News Conference
events.description: Rudy Giuliani, alongside other Trump campaign lawyers, held a news conference alleging a nationwide conspiracy of election fraud, making claims that were later fact-checked and dismissed by media.

events.title: CDC Thanksgiving Travel Warning
events.description: The CDC held a news briefing urging Americans not to travel for Thanksgiving due to the worsening COVID-19 pandemic, citing over 1 million new cases in the past week.

events.title: Federal Execution of Orlando Hall
events.description: The U.S. executed Orlando Cordia Hall by lethal injection for his role in a 1994 kidnapping and murder. This was the eighth federal execution since the Trump administration resumed them.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI news briefing summarizing current events from November 20, 2020; it contains no information specific to the Jeffrey Epstein case.
A major story covered is the indictment of Cincinnati Councilman P.G. Sittenfeld on federal bribery charges, part of a series of corruption cases in the city.
The briefing includes extensive coverage of President Trump's post-election legal challenges and efforts to contest the 2020 election results.
Multiple unrelated criminal investigations by the FBI are summarized, including drug trafficking, public corruption, and child exploitation cases across the U.S.
The CDC's urgent warning against Thanksgiving travel due to a surge in COVID-19 cases is a leading news item.
